topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54028ac863687234952d0000#post_54028ac863687234952d0000
A lot of European countries are pretty reliant on the trade with Russia as well, though. Like Finland.
Yeah, it will suck for Russia (the poor are already malnourished there, and the sanctions aren't gonna make it any better for them) but shit is going to fly in both directions, no doubt about that.


But in the meantime, i get to play 'spot the paid kremlin trolls'; a game where you look through the comment sections of news sites and spot the pro-russia trolls. Yes, they have paid trolls posting propaganda there, and they are exactly as obvious as you think.

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/540290176368721ddb7c0100#post_540290176368721ddb7c0100
Do you know the concept of a hegemony?

To make it short there needs to be a bully on the block, sure it sucks, sure I wish the USA would stay the fuck out of other countries, *BUT* the reason why there needs to be a top superpower is that before the concept was created the number of deaths in war was exponentially increasing before world war 2.  The reason why shit was so bad in world war 1 was that you had a bunch of countries with no real top dog all making treaties with each other and then one day the house of cards fell down.

I really hate the concept and I hate war, *BUT* they do have a point that there has to be a top dog or everyone starts breaking out into a angry mob where everyone is punching each other for no real reason.  I'll be the first to admit I hate war, but would you rather Russia be the political power house of the world?  Would you rather have Russia be the economic powerhouse of the world and telling other countries shit like saying that they want your country to imprison gays or such and that if you don't they'll bomb your ass?

Honestly it's outright depressing that this is how the world works politically.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/540293c663687219a91c0000#post_540293c663687219a91c0000
The long term probability is that the USA will drastically reduce funding towards the armed military(we can cut half our budget and still be on top by a lot) and that with how five out of the ten current wars are winding down this will cause a economic crash in the war economy driving up costs thus on top of that forcing less wars in the future.

Tl:dr; the world is going to become more peaceful due to economic reasons of there's less and less money being put towards war.

Tl:dr; of Tl:dr; war economy drying up.
